snippet: Moaz al-Khatib, the leader of the Syrian Opposition Council, may be building up his moderate coalition.
abstract: Obama administration officials say that Syrian opposition leaders Moaz al-Khatib and Gen Salim Idriss have postponed visit to Washington for series of high-profile meetings; observers speculate that decision may reflect Khatib's intention to spend time building moderate coalition at home, while others posit that it reflects caution about appearing too closely allied with Americans.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Moaz al-Khatib, the leader of the Syrian Opposition Council, may be building up his moderate coalition.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebel Leaders Delay Washington Trip
headline.main: Syria Opposition Leaders Delay Trip to Washington
headline.print_headline: Syria Opposition Leaders Delay Trip to Washington
